file_content.text: I have to take care of my colleagues, but we'll soon be back to work.
Don't! The station's yours, just don't kill anyone else!
The enemy is gone. I'm a Jedi Master; you're safe with me.
Relax. I'm a friend.
I came to help.
Thank the Progenitor. I thought we were finished.
If I was with them, you'd be dead already. Get up.
Fool. Do I look like a Sith?
You're that Jedi who's helping our homeworlds. Thank the Progenitor.
We're used to chemical spills, supply shortages and blackouts, but Sith? What did we ever do to them?
Anyway, thank you.
It is a Jedi's duty to protect the innocent from harm.
No need to thank me.
A friend of mine is still in this station. I should try to find her.
I'm going to look for Nadia.
Wait, Jedi. Before you leave--let us help you.
I saved you. I expect payment.
Ah. I understand. Well... what about this?
With our equipment destroyed, we can only continue one of our big projects. You decide which one, and you'll get our most promising discoveries in that field.
We have a classified weapons program, inspired by Quesh's toxins. Effective and very promising.
We also made a breakthrough in medical technology--new stims and healing techniques.
I'd like to see the benefits of this healing technology you've discovered.
Continue the medical research.
All right. Might work even better with a Jedi's metabolism.
This is your work, you know which project would be more useful.
You choose.
The medical research could save a lot of lives, as well as yours. That feels more worthwhile to me.
Focus on developing new armaments against the Empire. I'd like to be the first to try them.
Keep the weapons program.
All right. Seems sensible if the Empire's going to be playing rough.
There you are, Jedi! See, I said I'd be fine. I checked the station; it's all clear.
I'm heading back to the ship before father starts fretting. I'll meet you there.
You'd better go, Jedi. We'll be in touch.
